title: If the mother is 4 times as old as her daughter 5 years ago, how old is the mother now if the sum of their present ages is 55 years? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the Mother’s and daughter’s present ages be M and D. M = 4[D-5] = 4D - 20 …(1) M+D = 55, or M = 55-D …(2) Equate (1) and (2) 4D-20 = 55-D, or 5D = 75, or D = 15. M = 55–15 = 40. The Mother is 40 years now.

Answer : Present age of Mother is 41 Years and Daughter’s age is 14 Years Let Mother’s present age is ‘ X’ years and Daughters’s age is ‘Y’ As per given problem X + Y = 55 years ……Equation (1) (X-5) = 4 (Y-5) or ( X - 4 Y ) = ( -20 + 5) = (-15 ) …. Equation (2) By subtracting Equation (2 ) from Equation(1) we will get 5 Y = 70 or Y = (70/5) = 14 As X+ 14 = 55 then X = ( 55–14 ) = 41 Hence, Present age of Mother is 41 Years and Daughter’s age is 14 Years
